body:
Hey @fredbi ..
The other post which talks about this issue is giving custom tags for entire struct. Here, in this case, individual fields (properties) even with x-go-custom-tag in derived models are also capitalized. Struct that is getting generated is fine. The final unmarshalJSON() and marshaljson() methods that are generated has an private struct defined with different json tags. Is there a way we can override this behavior? Would it help to have custom templates here or is there any way not to generate those methods?

@jupudibhaskar967  You specified the upper case yourself by forcing `x-go-name`.
If you let this unspecified, or specify `x-go-name: ability` you get a tag with lower case.

Is that right? The x-go-name is normally to change the name of the go property but not the json property name. That should use the version that's defined in the json spec. 
The way the issue is worded, it is a bug in go-swagger
@fredbi Thanks for the quick reply. Removing the x-go-name worked. But as @casualjim  mentioned, it changed the json tag in the properties.
@casualjim yes i just tested it. There is some unwanted side effect of the x-go-name here.
Speaking of x-go-name there are a number of existing side issues with this (eg with nested additional properties etc). Unrolling this yarn completely might lead to quite significant work.

Specifically for allof serializer the bug is here and similar lines below:

https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/blob/5499abf2a8c86a57f3a8112aca47a624f609689e/generator/templates/tupleserializer.gotmpl#L259

If I am following the struct template, this should be .OriginalName not .Name. Of course this is just a quick intuition

issue.title: fixes undue propagation of x-go-name to tags in AllOf serializer
issue.body:
* fixes #2071
* added unit test on generated model

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>
